thread.title: Suspect linked to more holdups
thread.title_full: Suspect linked to more holdups | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Elise Kaplan / Journal Staff Writer
title: Suspect linked to more holdups
text:
MARTINEZ: Accused of several robberies
Before he was tracked down and arrested last month when he left his wallet at the scene of a robbery, police say Vincent Steven Martinez conducted six armed robberies at three other businesses around the Northeast Heights.
The Bernalillo County Sheriff’s Office easily identified Martinez, 38, as the suspect in an armed robbery of the Family Dollar on Second and Los Ranchos NW because they found his driver’s license in the wallet he dropped on the floor as he fled. He was arrested Sept. 15.
Once he was booked into the county jail, a detective with the Albuquerque Police Department realized Martinez matched the description of a man who robbed three businesses, two times each, throughout August and early September, according to a criminal complaint filed in Metropolitan Court.
Each time Martinez robbed a business, he would return less than a month later to rob it again, according to the complaint.
Police said he pointed a gun at the clerk at the Valero Gas Station on Moon and Indian School to get his largest haul of $252 and $36 worth of cigarettes, two weeks after robbing the same clerk of $60. He also robbed a clerk at La Quinta Inn on San Antonio near Interstate 25 at gunpoint and threatened clerks at the Holiday Inn on Alameda NE with a knife and a screwdriver, according to the complaint. The last time Martinez robbed the Holiday Inn he walked out without any cash, only credit cards. He was arrested in the Family Dollar robbery three days later.
Clerks and officers watching surveillance footage from each robbery were able to identify Martinez by an “X” tattooed on one calf and an “8” on the other, police said.
He was rebooked in the Metropolitan Detention Center on five counts of armed robbery and one count of assault with intent to commit a violent felony.
